groups.name: advanced
groups.helpMarkDown: When using "Run Deployment Plan from Scratch" strategy you may add this options as well

inputs.name: strategy
inputs.label: Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select weather to create a new deployment plan and run it of just execute an existing deployment plan.

inputs.name: applicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application where the deployment template is defined.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Project which the Deployment Plan belongs to.

inputs.name: templateCategory
inputs.label: Template Category
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Template Category which the Deployment Plan will be created from.
inputs.visibleRule: strategy = Run Deployment Plan from Scratch

inputs.name: deploymentTemplate
inputs.label: Deployment Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Deployment Template which the Deployment Plan will be created from.
inputs.visibleRule: strategy = Run Deployment Plan from Scratch

inputs.name: deploymentPlanName
inputs.label: Deployment Plan Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Deployment Plan which gonna be executed or the new created deployment plan when running from scratch.

inputs.name: build
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Deployment Plan Build number. Note - this is referring to RA build number which you defined when creating the Deployment Plan.

inputs.name: deploymentName
inputs.label: Deployment Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the new created deployment.

inputs.name: deploymentStageToPerform
inputs.label: Deployment Stage To Perform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Execute The stage after deployment has been created. default is to run all the stages

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.visibleRule: strategy = Run Deployment Plan from Scratch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum time to wait for Nolio Server to finish the deployment, default is 0 - meaning no timeout.

inputs.name: artifactPackageAsXML
inputs.label: Artifact Package as XML
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply a new Artifact Package in XML form.</br>You may generate such an XML from an existing artifact package in the Artifacts Packages page by hovering an item in the left panel list

inputs.name: artifactPackageName
inputs.label: Existing Artifact Package name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply an Existing Artifact Package name.

inputs.name: manifest
inputs.label: Manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply values for Release parameters in XML form.</br>You may generate the manifest from a deployment template, add the values to the XML and copy-paste it to here.

inputs.name: properties
inputs.label: Properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply values for template properties in 'key:values' form - Pairs of getter properties.</br>For example: "key1":"value1","key2":"value2".
